Themes

These are the themes that run through Al-Anon recovery — the subjects we actually talk about after the meeting. Each theme includes reflections and curated readings to deepen your understanding.

  • Control & Surrender Letting go of the need to manage everything and everyone.
  • Detachment & Boundaries Learning where I end and you begin.
  • Serenity & Sanity From a racing mind to a quiet, manageable one.
  • Fear & Courage Acting in spite of fear.
  • Self-Esteem & Identity Rebuilding the self that the disease diminished.
  • Trust Learning to rely on God, on others, and on ourselves.
  • Acceptance & Denial Seeing reality as it is, not as we wish it were.
  • Amends & Forgiveness Cleaning the past to free the future.
  • Honesty & Integrity Aligning the inside with the outside.
  • Higher Power & Faith A practical, personal spiritual partnership.
  • Growth & Patience The slow, often frustrating pace of spiritual change.
  • Service & Connection Healing through helping — the end of isolation.
  • Self-Care Taking charge of the only life I can actually live.
  • Relationships & Family Applying spiritual principles to the people closest to us.
  • Humility Being right-sized — neither a god nor a worm.
